newsitem.title: FRANCE: Europe share of Microsoft sales to fall.
newsitem.headline: Europe share of Microsoft sales to fall.

text.p: The European contribution to Microsoft Corp world sales is set to diminish in the coming years, Microsoft Europe president Bernard Vergnes said on Tuesday.

"It will come down for two reasons. Firstly, I believe that the dollar is undervalued and when it regains some value, European sales will be less in dollar terms. Secondly, the real big sales growth is in the Far East which will reduce our relative position," he told a news conference.
Europe represented 31 percent of worldwide sales for the 1996 fiscal year to June 30 and is expected to account for about the same percentage in the current fiscal year, he said.
